results.title: Volkswagen Beetle
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Design Classic Series”.
This car fulfilled Hitler’s dream that ‘everyone should be able to afford a car that would cost the same as a middle-class motorcycle’.

results.title: The Magic of the faraway tree. [Vol. 1]
results.creator_credit: Ben Turner, Abbey Home Entertainment and Cosgrove Hall Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Enchanted lands”.
A compilation of seven short animated stories from Enid Blyton’s Enchanted Lands series, “The Magic of the faraway tree”. Join in with the Magic Faraway Tree characters and their friends, Joe, Fran and Beth and experience some of their fantastic adventures in the many strange and magical lands at the top of the Faraway Tree. Beautifully animated with lots of colour, vibrancy and action. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Haig: the unknown soldier
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Time watch”.
Scottish field Marshall Sir Douglas Haig is infamous for being known as the man responsible for sending 723,000 British soldiers to their deaths - carnage on an unheard of scale. Inarticulate and stubborn, Haig was accused of being callous and incompetent, the “Butcher of the Somme,” the donkey in charge of the British army of lions. Lampooned and caricatured in the media - print then, television now (BlackAdder). Research by military historians into the performance of the British Army in World War 1 queries the myth of Haig as a buffoon in his position as British Commander in Chief on the Western Front, a post he assumed in December 1915. The program postulates that casualties were high given that it was a war of industrial powers and all that this entailed on a military scale. Provides brief biographical information, readings from Haig’s diary, interviews with historians and veterans and archival footage.

results.title: Unself portrait
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
This work is an experimental work/abstract narrative on the notion of self, or the lack of a self identity, as a human figure tries to understand who he is.

results.title: Lenin's secret files
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Time watch”.
‘Lenin’s secret files’ is part of an acclaimed investigative history series from the BBC which pursues new evidence and research of familiar historical events and figures. In this program the ethnic background, family, political ruthlessness and illness of Vladimir Illich Lenin, who, in 1917 led the Russian Revolution, are followed. It uses the personal archives of Lenin - which have only been accessible since the collapse of communism, to present a definitive portrait of one of history’s key figures.

results.title: The Adventures of the wishing chair
results.creator_credit: Jean Flynn, Abbey Home Entertainment and Cosgrove Hall Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Enchanted lands”.
A compilation of seven short animated stories from Enid Blyton’s Enchanted Lands series, “The Adventures of the wishing chair”. Let yourself be whisked away with Mollie, Peter and Jigs the Pixie on their amazing Wishing Chair to visit distant lands of magic, dreams and fantastical adventures. Meet some of the delightful, and not so delightful, characters along the way like Magician Greatheart, the Grabbit Gnomes and the playful Clown Gnomes. Beautifully animated with lots of colour, magic and movement. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Tumbleweeds
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
An dramatic look at the trouble faced by a teenage couple. The girl finds out that she is pregnant and has decided to give it up for adoption. The boy still loves her and they must face making the final decision together.

results.title: Stan
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
A bizarre and comical look at a machine which processes different types of people and converts into the same looking character. This animted short depicts the way society homogenises the way people are meant to be and disregards anyone who stands outside of the accepted norm.
